objectDesc.support: Parchment. ii + 97 + iii. The pastedowns are parchment flyleaves, s. xvi.
objectDesc.extent:
ca. 320 mm x ca. 225 mm (dimensions of - size of leaves).
ca. 268 mm x ca. 158 mm (dimensions of - size of written space).

binding: Binding of s. xviii. There are 3 blank parchments at the beginning and 4 at the end, the first and last of all being pasted down in the binding. Marks on the endleaves show that an older binding had four bosses on each cover. Ker 1957 makes a reference to the s. xvi binding of CUL Ii. 2. 4, which had four bosses on each cover, now missing. The volume is now kept in a green box with red label and gold lettering.

history.origin: Worcester. Written at Worcester by Hemming who also copied part of five other manuscripts. Glosses by Tremulous Hand in s. xiii2/4 in Worcester.
history.provenance: There is an inscription, 'Mathhæus Cantiar, 1574', at the head of fol. 3r.
history.acquisition: No. 3 in the list of manuscripts given by Archbishop Parker to Cambridge University in 1574. Old Cambridge marks are 'D. δ. 6' and '241'.

admin: Manuscript described by Takako Kato with the assistance of Hollie Morgan (2010; 2013). Thanks are due to Winfried Rudolf for his advice on the running titles and on Coleman.
